trans-unit.source: Light shafts
trans-unit.target: Light shafts

trans-unit.source: Beginner Designer Artist
trans-unit.target: Beginner Designer Artist

trans-unit.source: Light shafts, also called god rays, are visible rays of light.
trans-unit.target: Light shafts, also called god rays, are visible rays of light.

trans-unit.source: Stride light shafts are based on shadow maps and use raymarching rather than post effects, so they're visible even when the light source isn't. Any light source that casts shadows (ie point lights, directional lights and spot lights) can cast light shafts.
trans-unit.target: Stride light shafts are based on shadow maps and use raymarching rather than post effects, so they're visible even when the light source isn't. Any light source that casts shadows (ie point lights, directional lights and spot lights) can cast light shafts.

trans-unit.source: To create light shafts, use three components together: lights, light shafts, and light shaft bounding volumes.
trans-unit.target: To create light shafts, use three components together: lights, light shafts, and light shaft bounding volumes.

trans-unit.source: 1. Enable light shafts in the graphics compositor
trans-unit.target: 1. Enable light shafts in the graphics compositor

trans-unit.source: By default, Stride disables light shafts in new projects. To enable them:
trans-unit.target: By default, Stride disables light shafts in new projects. To enable them:

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor asset
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor asset

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor editor opens.
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor editor opens.

trans-unit.source: Select the forward renderer node.
trans-unit.target: Select the forward renderer node.

trans-unit.source: Select forward renderer
trans-unit.target: Select forward renderer

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), next to Light shafts, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select LightShafts.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), next to Light shafts, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select LightShafts.

trans-unit.source: Select light shafts
trans-unit.target: Select light shafts

trans-unit.source: Make sure the light shafts checkbox is selected.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the light shafts checkbox is selected.

trans-unit.source: Enable light shafts
trans-unit.target: Enable light shafts

trans-unit.source: For more information about the graphics compositor, see the Graphics compositor page.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the graphics compositor, see the Graphics compositor page.

trans-unit.source: 2. Add a light shaft component
trans-unit.target: 2. Add a light shaft component

trans-unit.source: In your scene, select the entity with the light you want to create light shafts. This must be a light that casts shadows (ie a point light, directional light, or spot light).
trans-unit.target: In your scene, select the entity with the light you want to create light shafts. This must be a light that casts shadows (ie a point light, directional light, or spot light).

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, in the Light component properties, make sure the Shadow checkbox is selected.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, in the Light component properties, make sure the Shadow checkbox is selected.

trans-unit.source: Enable light shafts
trans-unit.target: Enable light shafts

trans-unit.source: Click Add component and select Light shaft.
trans-unit.target: Click Add component and select Light shaft.

trans-unit.source: Add light shaft component
trans-unit.target: Add light shaft component

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a light shaft component to the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a light shaft component to the entity.

trans-unit.source: 3. Add a bounding volume
trans-unit.target: 3. Add a bounding volume

trans-unit.source: The light shaft bounding volume defines the area in which light shafts are created. You can add the bounding volume to the same entity that has the directional light, but it's usually simpler to add it to a separate entity.
trans-unit.target: The light shaft bounding volume defines the area in which light shafts are created. You can add the bounding volume to the same entity that has the directional light, but it's usually simpler to add it to a separate entity.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click Add asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click Add asset.

trans-unit.source: Under Models, select a model in the shape you want the volume to be. For example, if you use a cube, light shafts will be created in a cube-shaped area.
trans-unit.target: Under Models, select a model in the shape you want the volume to be. For example, if you use a cube, light shafts will be created in a cube-shaped area.

trans-unit.source: Cube model
trans-unit.target: Cube model

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Select an asset
trans-unit.target: Select an asset

trans-unit.source: You don't need a material for the model, so click Cancel to create a model without a material.
trans-unit.target: You don't need a material for the model, so click Cancel to create a model without a material.

trans-unit.source: In the scene, create an empty entity. For now, it doesn't matter where you put it; you can reposition it later.
trans-unit.target: In the scene, create an empty entity. For now, it doesn't matter where you put it; you can reposition it later.

trans-unit.source: With the entity selected, in the Property Grid, click Add component and select light shaft bounding volume.
trans-unit.target: With the entity selected, in the Property Grid, click Add component and select light shaft bounding volume.

trans-unit.source: Add light shaft bounding volume component
trans-unit.target: Add light shaft bounding volume component

trans-unit.source: In the light shaft bounding volume component properties, next to light shaft, click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: In the light shaft bounding volume component properties, next to light shaft, click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: In the entity picker, select the entity with the directional light you want to create light shafts and click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the entity picker, select the entity with the directional light you want to create light shafts and click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the light shaft bounding volume component properties, next to Model, click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: In the light shaft bounding volume component properties, next to Model, click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: In the Select an asset window, select the model you created and click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Select an asset window, select the model you created and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Select model
trans-unit.target: Select model

trans-unit.source: This model defines the shape of the light shaft bounding volume.
trans-unit.target: This model defines the shape of the light shaft bounding volume.

trans-unit.source: Using the transform component, position and scale the entity to cover the area where you want to create light shafts.
trans-unit.target: Using the transform component, position and scale the entity to cover the area where you want to create light shafts.

trans-unit.source: !Tip To show or hide navigation light shaft bounding volumes in the Scene Editor, in the Scene Editor toolbar, open the gizmo options menu and use the Light shaft bounding volumes checkbox.
trans-unit.target: !Tip To show or hide navigation light shaft bounding volumes in the Scene Editor, in the Scene Editor toolbar, open the gizmo options menu and use the Light shaft bounding volumes checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Show light shaft bounding volumes
trans-unit.target: Show light shaft bounding volumes

trans-unit.source: Light shaft properties
trans-unit.target: Light shaft properties

trans-unit.source: Light shaft properties
trans-unit.target: Light shaft properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Density
trans-unit.target: Density

trans-unit.source: Higher values produce brighter light shafts
trans-unit.target: Higher values produce brighter light shafts

trans-unit.source: Sample count
trans-unit.target: Sample count

trans-unit.source: Higher values produce better light shafts but use more GPU
trans-unit.target: Higher values produce better light shafts but use more GPU

trans-unit.source: Process bounding volumes separately
trans-unit.target: Process bounding volumes separately

trans-unit.source: Preserves light shaft quality when seen through separate bounding boxes, but uses more GPU
trans-unit.target: Preserves light shaft quality when seen through separate bounding boxes, but uses more GPU

trans-unit.source: Light shaft graphics compositor properties
trans-unit.target: Light shaft graphics compositor properties

trans-unit.source: To access these properties, in the graphics compositor editor, select the forward renderer node and expand Light Shafts.
trans-unit.target: To access these properties, in the graphics compositor editor, select the forward renderer node and expand Light Shafts.

trans-unit.source: These properties apply globally to all the light shafts in the scene.
trans-unit.target: These properties apply globally to all the light shafts in the scene.

trans-unit.source: Light shaft graphics compositor properties
trans-unit.target: Light shaft graphics compositor properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Bounding volume buffer downsample level
trans-unit.target: Bounding volume buffer downsample level

trans-unit.source: Lower values produce more precise volume buffer areas, but use more GPU
trans-unit.target: Lower values produce more precise volume buffer areas, but use more GPU

trans-unit.source: Light buffer downsample level
trans-unit.target: Light buffer downsample level

trans-unit.source: Lower values produce sharper light shafts, but use more GPU
trans-unit.target: Lower values produce sharper light shafts, but use more GPU

trans-unit.source: Optimize light shafts
trans-unit.target: Optimize light shafts

trans-unit.source: Light shafts work best in dark environments. You can adjust the light and light shaft component properties to achieve different results — for example, by changing the light color (in the light component properties) or the light shaft density (in the light shaft component properties).
trans-unit.target: Light shafts work best in dark environments. You can adjust the light and light shaft component properties to achieve different results — for example, by changing the light color (in the light component properties) or the light shaft density (in the light shaft component properties).

trans-unit.source: Multiple light shafts viewed through one another can become visually noisy, as in the screenshot below:
trans-unit.target: Multiple light shafts viewed through one another can become visually noisy, as in the screenshot below:

trans-unit.source: Noisy light shafts
trans-unit.target: Noisy light shafts

trans-unit.source: To reduce this effect, in the light shaft component properties, reduce the density and increase the sample count.
trans-unit.target: To reduce this effect, in the light shaft component properties, reduce the density and increase the sample count.

trans-unit.source: Density factor
trans-unit.target: Density factor

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, add additional bounding volumes and process them separately. To do this:
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, add additional bounding volumes and process them separately. To do this:

trans-unit.source: Create additional bounding volumes and position them to cover the areas where you want to create light shafts. Make sure the bounding volumes don't overlap, as this makes light shafts extra-bright.
trans-unit.target: Create additional bounding volumes and position them to cover the areas where you want to create light shafts. Make sure the bounding volumes don't overlap, as this makes light shafts extra-bright.

trans-unit.source: In the light shaft component properties, make sure Process bounding volumes separately is selected.
trans-unit.target: In the light shaft component properties, make sure Process bounding volumes separately is selected.

trans-unit.source: Separate bounding volume
trans-unit.target: Separate bounding volume

trans-unit.source: !Note Processing bounding volumes separately uses more GPU.
trans-unit.target: !Note Processing bounding volumes separately uses more GPU.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
